title: I have two Drafts folders instead of one
content: Hi there! I am using Thunderbird with an Outlook e-mail account. Due to the slowness and cumbersomeness of the syncing with the Outlook IMAP server I have deleted my IMAP account and created a POP3 account. Now all is well except for one thing: I have two Drafts folders. One of them is named Drafts - Local Folders, the other Drafts - OUTLOOK - Local Folders. They are both sub-folders of my Drafts folders. I am almost certain that the second one is a leftover from my deleted IMAP account. I have found some discussions and “solutions” of this issue online but none of them seem to fit my situation, and the instructions in them do not reflect what happens on my screen. Any assistance you may care to provide will be very much appreciated.

title: Thunderbird Cannot Send Email Through Outlook Account
content:
I installed Thunderbird 115.0.1 on Windows 11. I configured it for two accounts. One was a custom domain managed by Google, the second an Outlook account with my Office365 subscription.

Both receive mail fine. Neither would send mail. Investigating further I found that Thunderbird never got a firewall exception. I added the exception and now the Google account sends and receives fine. Outlook will still not send.

I've removed and re-added the Outlook account a couple of times now. No joy. I have found a lot of conflicting information on SMTP server settings but currently have the queried (auto configured) smtp.office365.com server on port 587 with my account credentials for login, connection security of 'STARTTLS' and authentication method of 'normal password'.

I've tried a couple of other email clients and they work out of the box. Any help would be appreciated.

-T
creator: tjcorcoran

title: All incoming mail goes direct to JUNK, how do I correct it?
content: All of our incoming emails go directly to JUNK. I cannot find how to change settings to have the mail go to our InBox instead of Junk.
creator: wildlife.regs

title: Thunderbird Replacing Received Email with Duplicates
content:
Hopefully, I can explain this to where it makes sense. I have been having a long term issue with Thunderbird replacing received emails with existing emails that I have already received.

Example: I get an email from tom@email.com titled "Hello." I get an email after that from joy@usa.com titled "Need Your Help." Thunderbird will replace the email from joy@usa.com with the email from tom@email.com and then I have two emails from tom@email.com in my inbox and the one from joy@usa.com is gone. If I sign into my webmail client, both the emails from tom@email.com and joy@usa.com are there with no duplicates like in Thunderbird.

So, this indicates to me this is a Thunderbird issue. It happens randomly too. Sometimes I can go days without this happening and then suddenly it happens multiple times a day over several days. Is anyone else having this issue and is there a solution?
creator: charles120

Hi, I've noticed that the actual sender's email address in thunderbird old/new is only visible when I open the individual email message. Currently, I'm using an add-on to facilitate this, but integrating this feature directly into the platform could be a significant improvement.

title: Cannot send messages after installing Thunderbird
content:
We just got two new office computers and Windows Mail sucks.

So I downloaded Thunderbird, and set up my accounts as described by both Shaw's website and Thunderbird's.

Everything seemed to be working ok until I tried sending my first email. I got this message:

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: shw-obgw-4003a.ext.cloudfilter.net cmsmtp Connection Rejected - see http://www.spamhaus.org/query/ip/207.194.98.229 AUP#IPBL00001.

I tried changing the port to 2525 as I read in a Thunderbird forum that worked for some, but it just changed the error message slightly...

Any assistance would be greatly appreciated, as I just want a mail app that I can create folders in!

The scrollbars are visible, if I click and drag them they work, if I use the up/down arrow keys the window scrolls as expected, it's just the mouse wheel doesn't work. Mouse wheel works in other programs ex firefox.

creator: jake.harris

title: Folder view "Unread folders"
content:
Hello,

a few days ago I switched to the new version 115 and I find it very nice. In my daily work, I use View > Folders > Unread Folders most often.

If I now open unread mails in a folder, the folder is actually no longer an "unread folder". In the "old" version of Thunderbird, folders were refreshed at irregular intervals and folders were automatically hidden when there were no more new mails to read.

This no longer happens with 115. Here the read folders remain visible all day or until I manually select View > Folders > Unread Folders again.

I would therefore be very pleased if this old function were possible again.

Thank you and best regards from Berlin Florian
creator: Florian_Berlin

title: can't add senders to contacts
content:
I have version 102.11.0

I am trying to add email addresses to my contacts folder from the email header. I right click on the address and a box opens up that says "add cardbook contact" and I choose the address book I want the address added to.

Then a full screen opens up for the contact - at the top it says "register a new email address"

(It sure would be nice if all the language was the same. Is this a cardbook? an address book? Am I adding a contact or registering an email address? What does "register" mean? All of this variety only adds confusion.)

That screen has the email address and contact name entered in the proper fields - I scroll down, look all around, but nowhere can I find a "save," "done" "ok" or other button to click. And sure enough, when I close the screen, no contact has been added that I can find.

I would really like to be able to add contacts this way - otherwise I have to copy and paste, etc. etc.

Can anyone help? I'm on Linux Mint 21.1 Cinnamon

title: Loss of 2 email address from sent, draft, junk and trash folders after recent update of Thunderbird
content:
I would like to thank all the volunteers for helping me in the past over many years after discovering many successful solutions that have been offered.

Thunderbird - loss of 2 email address (of 6) from the Sent, Draft, Junk and Trash folders after recent (approx 18th Jul 2023) update of Thunderbird.

In particular Tbird displays my 2 Gmail addresses and 2 iiNet.net.au addresses but not my own domain name or my hotmail.com.

So far my workaround is that when I send an email I also bcc myself which gives me a copy of the sent email in my Inbox, not only tedious but potentially a loss if I forget. I only know if the recipients receive the email if their reply to me has their received email in tow (which I just now discovered - phew!)

So the problem seems to be a display issue within Tbird itself. Also the recent update has changed the location of various buttons, which after a lot of searching, I found lurking in unexpected and difficult to reach places. Naturally this takes time and I'm sure I will find previous buttons lurking somewhere.

Has anybody else found odd responses from the recent update?

Enjoy the rest of the day and all subsequent days!!
creator: georgec4
